title: THE NEW YORK PRIMARY; The Vote for Mayor and Comptroller, District by District

body: LEAD: Two Brooklyn girls were shot, one fatally, in two separate shooting incidents yesterday, the police said. A man was killed in the second shooting. Two Brooklyn girls were shot, one fatally, in two separate shooting incidents yesterday, the police said. A man was killed in the second shooting. A 14-year-old girl was found at 12:50 P.M., shot
title: 2 Girls Are Shot in Brooklyn; One Is Killed, One Wounded

body: LEAD: Hundreds of mourners and residents of the drug-torn Bushwick section of Brooklyn came out yesterday to bury a slain woman who had fought against drugs in her community. They marched and chanted in a two-mile funeral procession from the church to the cemetery. Hundreds of mourners and residents of the drug-torn Bushwick section of Brooklyn
title: Hundreds Mourn Brooklyn Drug Fighter

body: LEAD: Mourners for Maria Hernandez, the woman who campaigned against drugs in her Brooklyn neighborhood and who was slain Tuesday, were evacuated yesterday from a funeral home after a telephone caller said a bomb was in the building, the police said. Mourners for Maria Hernandez, the woman who campaigned against drugs in her Brooklyn neighborhood
title: Anti-Drug Crusader's Wake Is Disrupted by Bomb Threat

body: LEAD: Eugene J. Keogh, who as a Congressman from Brooklyn was the principal sponsor of the pension-plan legislation that bears his name, died of pneumonia yesterday at St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived in Manhattan. Eugene J. Keogh, who as a Congressman from Brooklyn was the principal sponsor of the pension-plan legislation that
title: Ex-Congressman Eugene Keogh, Pension Plan Sponsor, Dies at 81

body: LEAD: Four New Yorkers and seven neighborhood groups were cited last night for efforts to make the city a better place to live. Four New Yorkers and seven neighborhood groups were cited last night for efforts to make the city a better place to live. They received annual awards from the Citizens Committee for New York City, founded in 1975 by
title: Community Groups And 4 New Yorkers Are Cited for Service
